intro: Tournaya, commonly known as false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are herbaceous perennials with dark green, often basal leaves that are lance-shaped or elliptic. They produce showy, umbellate inflorescences with white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Tournaya species are noted for their ornamental value and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their attractive foliage and flowers.
